```java
public boolean SendToActuator(String message) {

        if (connected == false) {
            disconnectedTimeout++;
```

```java
public void writeBytes(String val) throws IOException {
    int len = val.length();
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        write((byte)val.charAt(i));
    }
}
```

This code writes the string to the output stream byte by byte. It converts each character in the string to its corresponding ASCII value and writes it to the output stream.

The write method is used to write a single byte to the output stream. The byte is converted to an unsigned value before it is written.

The IOException is thrown if an I/O error occurs.

This method is synchronized to prevent multiple threads from attempting to write to the same DataOutputStream concurrently.
